intro: Museniopsis madrensis, commonly known as the Madreño museniopsis, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are narrow and often have a subtle aromatic scent, while its flowers bloom in late spring or early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Museniopsis madrensis is considered a species of conservation concern.
